item.title: 迪拜亿万富翁的子女计划重振陷入困境的世界群岛
item.description: 多年来，一个按照世界地图形状建造的人工群岛一直被视为迪拜濒临破产的象征。现在，一位亿万富翁开发商的子女正试图重振这一项目，他们将在这里建造起价 1360 万美元的海滨豪宅。【原文：For years, an artificial archipelago built in the shape of a world map was seen as a symbol of the excesses that brought Dubai to the brink of bankruptcy. Now, the children of a billionaire developer are seeking to revive the project with beachfront mansions starting at $13.6 million.】

item.title: Lululemon 亿万富翁向高盛抵押股票以获得保证金贷款
item.description: Lululemon Athletica 公司创始人奇普-威尔逊（Chip Wilson）抵押了他在这家瑜伽服生产商所持有的数十亿美元股份中的一大部分，以获得高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Lululemon Athletica Inc. founder Chip Wilson pledged a chunk of his multibillion-dollar stake in the yogawear maker to secure financing from Goldman Sachs Group Inc., leveraging his biggest listed asset.】

item.title: 市场压力持续，沙特化工巨头利润下滑
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯最大的化工公司报告称，由于需求疲软，该行业面临压力，利润同比下降了 62%。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s top chemicals company reported a 62% drop in year-on-year profit as weak demand puts the industry under stress.】

item.title: 克里斯-罗科斯的 170 亿美元对冲基金收益扩大至约 20
item.description: 亿万富翁克里斯-罗科斯（Chris Rokos）的对冲基金巩固了其作为今年迄今为止表现最好的宏观资金池之一的地位，年初至今的收益已达到约 20%。【原文：Billionaire Chris Rokos’s hedge fund cemented its position as one of the best performing macro money pool so far this year, with year-to-date gains now reaching about 20%.】

item.title: 高盛德国投资银行部主管梅耶尔加盟摩根大通
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is hiring Alexander Mayer, head of Germany and Austria investment banking at Goldman Sachs Group Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 万事达卡下调预测，网络支出低于预期
item.description: 万事达卡公司（Mastercard Inc.【原文：Mastercard Inc. cut its forecast for revenue growth for the year and spending on the payments giant’s network missed estimates.】

item.title: 美联储按兵不动，企业回购为股市带来尾风
item.description: 随着美联储发出计划推迟降息的信号，投资者寄希望于企业回购的复苏来帮助维持今年股市的涨势。【原文：As the Federal Reserve signals it plans to delay interest rate cuts, investors are counting on a revival in corporate buybacks to help sustain this year’s stock market rally.】

item.title: 美国银行对期权-ETF 热潮发出警告，日内交易者纷纷涌入
item.description: 过去两年，华尔街说服谨慎的股票投资者将数十亿美元投入利用期权提高收益率的交易所交易基金。【原文：Over the last two years, Wall Street has convinced cautious equity investors to send billions of dollars into exchange-traded funds that use options to goose yields.】

item.title: 煤炭是难以戒除的习惯
item.description:
Glencore公司最大的投资者在看到矿产所带来的利润时，愿意忽视矿产在气候变化中的作用。【原文：

Glencore Plc’s biggest investors are willing to overlook the mineral’s role in climate change when they see the profit it generates.

】

item.title: 多户住宅业主陷入困境，商业地产 CLO 贷款逾期回购猛增 210
item.description: 随着多户住宅抵押贷款的拖欠率不断攀升，将这些借款捆绑成证券（被称为商业房地产抵押贷款义务）的贷款人正竞相避免麻烦。【原文：As delinquencies on multifamily mortgages pile up, lenders who had bundled those borrowings into securitizations known as commercial real estate collateralized loan obligations are racing to stave off trouble.】

item.title: 资金紧张迫使可可贸易商推迟西非采购
item.description: 据熟悉这一过程的人士称，全球可可市场的流动性紧缩正迫使贸易商推迟从全球最大的可可生产商那里购买可可豆。【原文：A liquidity crunch upending the global cocoa market is forcing traders to delay bean purchases from the world’s largest producers, according to people familiar with the process.】

item.title: 巴克莱开始在投资银行裁员
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）已开始裁员数百人，该公司正着手削减 20 亿英镑的成本，这是首席执行官文卡塔克里什南（C.S. Venkatakrishnan）长达数年的提高回报计划的一部分。【原文：Barclays Plc has begun cutting hundreds of jobs as the firm embarks on a £2 billion cost-cutting drive that’s part of Chief Executive Officer C.S. Venkatakrishnan’s yearslong plan to boost returns.】

item.title: 可可价格剧烈波动在交易清淡的市场中有所缓解
item.description: 可可价格再次出现波动，但由于流动性不足助长了剧烈波动，与近期相比，价格波动相对平静。阿拉比卡咖啡延续跌势。【原文：Cocoa prices swung again, but in relatively calmer fashion than recently seen as a lack of liquidity fueled extreme moves. Arabica coffee extended declines.】

item.title: 纽约市广播公司在经历了艰难的一季度后，业绩好于最坏的预期
item.description: 纽约社区银行公司（New York Community Bancorp Inc.【原文：New York Community Bancorp Inc.’s charge-offs and provisions for potential loan losses declined in the first quarter from the previous three months, which could help allay commercial-property concerns that have hounded the lender since it last reported results.】

item.title: 布雷万-霍华德（Brevan Howard）收购天然气专家 Alpen，打造大宗商品部门
item.description: 布雷万-霍华德资产管理公司（Brevan Howard Asset Management）正在聘请天然气专家罗伯特-阿尔朋（Robert Alpen），在退出市场近十年后重返大宗商品交易领域。【原文：Brevan Howard Asset Management is hiring gas specialist Robert Alpen as it returns to trading commodities after nearly a decade out of the markets.】

item.title: Peel Hunt 称，出售 NatWest 的现金应转入英国主权基金
item.description: Peel Hunt Ltd.的研究主管查尔斯-霍尔（Charles Hall）认为，英国政府应该利用出售其持有的75亿英镑（约合94亿美元）的NatWest Group Plc股份所获得的收益来成立一个主权财富基金，以帮助重振该国萎靡不振的股票市场。【原文：The UK government should use the proceeds from selling its £7.5 billion ($9.4 billion) share in NatWest Group Plc to set up a sovereign wealth fund to help revive the country’s ailing equity market, according to Charles Hall, head of research at Peel Hunt Ltd.】

item.title: KKR 盈利调整后第一季度利润超预期
item.description: KKR & Co.公司公布的第一季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，因为这家另类资产管理公司改变了发布财务业绩的方式，强调经常性盈利而不是低迷的私募股权资产销售。【原文：KKR & Co. reported first-quarter profit that beat Wall Street estimates after the alternative asset manager changed how it relays financial results to emphasize recurring earnings over lumpier private equity asset sales.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。在市场等待美联储今天晚些时候的利率决定和评论之际，股票期货走低。同时，随着财报季的继续，万事达卡（Mastercard）和辉瑞制药（Pfizer）等公司的财报仍是市场关注的焦点。【原文：Good morning. Stock futures are pointing lower as markets await the Fed’s rate decision and commentary later today. Meanwhile stocks remain in focus as earnings season continues, with Mastercard and Pfizer among companies reporting.】

item.title: CVS 以医疗成本上升为由下调年度利润预期
item.description: CVS Health Corp. 连续第二个季度下调了全年盈利展望，原因是医疗费用的上涨继续给该公司的医疗保险业务带来压力。【原文：CVS Health Corp. lowered its yearly earnings outlook for the second quarter in a row, as rising medical costs continue to put a strain on the company’s Medicare insurance business.】

item.title: 租用资产负债表：银行寻求规避资本规则的方法
item.description: 多年来，巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）一直在为如何处理其美国信用卡业务而苦恼。它是一个现金生成器，能带来源源不断的收入，但由于监管机构强制银行留出资本金作为损失缓冲，它的运营成本很高。【原文：For years, Barclays Plc struggled with what to do about its US credit-card business. It was a cash generator, cranking out a steady stream of revenue, and yet it was costly to run because of the way regulators force banks to set aside capital as a buffer against losses.】

item.title: 土耳其提高里拉存款利息税以削减预算赤字
item.description: 土耳其提高了里拉储蓄利息收入税，以增加国家收入，帮助缩小不断膨胀的预算赤字。【原文：Turkey raised the tax on interest income from lira savings to improve state revenues and help narrow a burgeoning budget deficit.】

item.title: 据说迪拜日落酒店集团将寻求 3 亿美元的扩张资金
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，迪拜日落酒店集团（Sunset Hospitality Group）旗下品牌包括 Sushisamba 连锁餐厅和豪华 METT Hotels & Resorts，该集团正寻求筹集约 3 亿美元用于扩张计划。【原文：Dubai’s Sunset Hospitality Group, which encompasses brands including the Sushisamba restaurant chain and the luxury METT Hotels & Resorts, is seeking to raise about $300 million for expansion plans, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 凯雷私募股权投资公司利润因大量销售而增长
item.description: 凯雷投资集团（Carlyle Group）的私募股权交易商们加快了退出交易的步伐，使得第一季度盈利超过了华尔街的预期。【原文：Carlyle Group’s private equity dealmakers fueled first-quarter earnings that beat Wall Street estimates as they stepped up the pace of exiting deals.】

item.title: 交易员倒计时美联储会议，债券难见起色
item.description: 全球债券市场下一步将从一系列美国经济数据和美联储的决定中寻找线索，所有这些都有可能将固定收益资产的反弹推向更远的未来。【原文：Global bond markets will take their next cue from a slew of US economic data and the Federal Reserve’s decision, all of which risk pushing a rebound in fixed-income assets further into the future.】

item.title: 市场疲软情况下的日元买盘数量显示出干预的局限性
item.description: 日本周一疑似进行了货币干预，这引发了人们的疑问：日本当局需要走多远才能有意义地支撑日元。【原文：Japan’s suspected currency intervention on Monday is raising questions about how far authorities will need to go to meaningfully prop up the yen.】

item.title: 投资基金加大对欧洲天然气价格反弹的押注
item.description: 投资者加大了对欧洲天然气价格上涨的押注，担心随着市场焦点转向为明年冬季建立库存，进一步的供应中断将引发更大的市场波动。【原文：Investors increased bets on higher European natural gas prices, fearing that further supply disruptions will trigger even more market volatility as the focus turns to building stockpiles for next winter.】

item.title: 据说 KPS 将牵头竞购价值 30 亿欧元的西门子电机部门
item.description: 知情人士透露，KPS Capital Partners 正在成为收购西门子公司 Innomotics 大型电机业务的领跑者。【原文：KPS Capital Partners is emerging as the frontrunner to acquire Siemens AG’s Innomotics large motors business, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: Nord Anglia 吸引 Permira 和 KKR 对 150 亿美元的 EQT 退出感兴趣
item.description: 据知情人士透露，国际学校运营商Nord Anglia正吸引私募股权投资公司和主权财富基金的兴趣，因为该公司的所有者正寻求将其股份货币化。【原文：International school operator Nord Anglia is drawing interest from private equity players and sovereign wealth funds as its owners look to monetize their stakes, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 诺和诺德在丹麦削减对 Ozempic 的补贴
item.description: 在诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk A/S）的母国丹麦，对 Ozempic 的补贴将受到限制，原因是用于这种糖尿病特效药的公共开支不断增加，而这种药物正越来越多地被用作减肥治疗。【原文：Subsidies for Ozempic will be restricted in Novo Nordisk A/S’s home country of Denmark due to rising public spending on the blockbuster diabetes medicine, which is increasingly being used as a weight-loss treatment.】

item.title: 越南议会将在领导人辞职后召开特别会议
item.description: 越南国会主席上周辞职后，国会将于周四下午召开特别会议讨论人事问题。【原文：Vietnam’s National Assembly will convene Thursday afternoon for a special meeting to discuss personnel issues after its chairman resigned last week.】
